oai_dc:dc.dc:title: High-rise view of the Cohen Building, Nashville, Tennessee, 2012 May
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A high-rise view of the Cohen Building, a commercial property located at 421 Church Street in downtown Nashville, pictured between the Downtown Presbyterian Church and the Viridian Towers. The Cohen Building, designed in the Italian Renaissance style, was erected in 1890, as the townhouse and business property of Meyer and George Etta Brinkley Cohen. The couple owned a successful jewelry shop on the first floor and resided on the top two levels of their lavish townhouse. The Cohen Building has been renovated and restored in recent years. Forms part of the Leanne Garland Photograph Collection. 1 digital photograph.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Cohen, Meyer
